input.title: EU ESRS Update on Value-Chain Data Granularity
input.text: The European Sustainability Reporting Standards (ESRS) update introduces enhanced requirements for value-chain data granularity. Companies must provide detailed supplier-level emissions data and category mappings to ensure alignment with CDP and CSRD frameworks. This is mandatory for all large companies.

expected.rationale: Contains 'disclosure', 'reporting', 'mandatory', 'must' keywords. Mentions 'supplier', 'value-chain' indicating Scope 3. Status inferred from 'update' and 'introduces' suggesting already adopted.

input.text: The UK Emissions Trading Scheme proposes expanding coverage to additional industrial sectors while phasing out free allocation for certain high-emitting industries. The proposal includes transitional support mechanisms and enhanced monitoring requirements.

input.title: California Methane LDAR Update
input.text: California has updated its Leak Detection and Repair (LDAR) requirements for methane emissions. The new rules mandate more frequent monitoring intervals and require detailed methane-intensity reporting for oil and gas operations.

expected.rationale: Contains 'requirements', 'mandate', 'require' indicating mandatory ban. 'Updated' and 'new rules' suggests Effective status. Direct emissions from oil/gas suggests Scope 1.

input.text: The CSDDD requires large companies to conduct human rights and environmental due diligence throughout their value chains. Companies must identify, prevent, mitigate, and account for adverse impacts, with civil liability for non-compliance.

input.title: EU CBAM Reporting Phase
input.text: The Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) enters its reporting phase, requiring importers to declare embedded emissions in covered goods. Supplier declarations and detailed emissions calculations become mandatory for steel, cement, aluminum, fertilizers, and electricity.
